title: Jens Stoltenberg | Prime Minister of Norway & NATO Secretary-General | Britannica

quotes: the Labour Youth League from 1985 to 1989
In 1989 he briefly returned to the University of Oslo as a lecturer in economics.
The following year Stoltenberg was appointed leader of the Oslo branch of the DNA (1990–92).
He became a member of the Storting, Norway’s parliament, in 1993,
serving as minister of trade and energy (1993–96)
and minister of finance (1996–97)
In 1997 the Labour Party lost power,
Stoltenberg served as leader of the committee on oil and energy (1997–2000)
In 2000 Bondevik stepped down from the premiership
He took office as prime minister on March 17, 2000,
In the 2001 elections the DNA received only one-fourth of the vote,
Stoltenberg won the battle in 2002.
In 2005 he led a Red-Green coalition
In 2009, in another tight race,
Stoltenberg became the first Norwegian prime minister to achieve reelection since 1993.
His calm, measured response to a pair of terror attacks in 2011
Even as much of the rest of the world struggled in the wake of the international financial crisis that had begun in 2008,
